result.execSummary:
The defendant Lynette L McIntosh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: To be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with Kirklnd's Home Furnishings.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber- Court orders 20 days. Court grants 5 days credit.
First 14 days with release for work. treatment and/or health care release.
Last 6 days, stayed, to be used at the agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.

06/14/2018 PER REVIEW HEARING, HUBER CHANGED TO 30 DAYS ELECTRONIC MONITORING AT HOME WITH RELEASE FOR HEALTH CARE ONLY (5 DAYS CREDIT). DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO WCS TODAY.
LAST 10 DAYS ARE STAYED FOR USE AT AGENT'S DISCRETION. AGENT TO DETERMINE WITH OR WITHOUT NON-WORKING HOURS.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lynette L McIntosh in court with attorney Anna Kees on Behalf of attorney Katie B. Kegel.  Adam Stuart appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addresses defendant's request to stay condition time. State takes no position. 

Court amends Defendant's sentence as follows:

30 Days Electronic Monitoring at home with release for health care only. (Apply 5 days credit) - Defendant to report to WCS today.
10 Days, Stayed to be used at the Agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non-working hours.
Review hearing on June 14, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Dated 6/7/18 from Attorney Kegel - Completion of Representation
6/5/18 Letter from Attorney Kegel requesting stay of condition time.
Sentencing hearing on May 24, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lynette L McIntosh in court with attorney Katie B. Kegel.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 with the Repeater allegation stricken.  Court finds defendant guilty.
16CM57 was dismissed and read in to this matter.   The State files a Read In List in this matter.
Attorney Kegel is requesting a separate sentencing date.
The court grants request and set the matter out to May.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 12, 2018 at 02:15 pm.
